description: Describes your network ACLs. The default is to describe all your network ACLs. Alternatively, you can specify specific network ACL IDs or filter the results to include only the network ACLs that match specific criteria. For more information, see Network ACLs in the Amazon VPC User Guide.

parameters.name: NetworkAclIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the network ACLs. (string) ---

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: The filters. association.association-id - The ID of an association ID for the ACL. association.network-acl-id - The ID of the network ACL involved in the association. association.subnet-id - The ID of the subnet involved in the association. default - Indicates whether the ACL is the default network ACL for the VPC. entry.cidr - The IPv4 CIDR range specified in the entry. entry.icmp.code - The ICMP code specified in the entry, if any. entry.icmp.type - The ICMP type specified in the entry, if any. entry.ipv6-cidr - The IPv6 CIDR range specified in the entry. entry.port-range.from - The start of the port range specified in the entry. entry.port-range.to - The end of the port range specified in the entry. entry.protocol - The protocol specified in the entry ( tcp | udp | icmp or a protocol number). entry.rule-action - Allows or denies the matching traffic ( allow | deny). entry.egress - A Boolean that indicates the type of rule. Specify true for egress rules, or false for ingress rules. entry.rule-number - The number of an entry (in other words, rule) in the set of ACL entries. network-acl-id - The ID of the network ACL. owner-id - The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the network ACL. tag - The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all resources that have a tag with the key Owner and the value TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value. tag-key - The key of a tag assigned to the resource. Use this filter to find all resources assigned a tag with a specific key, regardless of the tag value. vpc-id - The ID of the VPC for the network ACL. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

nested_items.name: NetworkAcls
nested_items.description: Information about the network ACLs.

nested_items.name: Associations
nested_items.description: Any associations between the network ACL and your subnets.

nested_items.name: NetworkAclAssociationId
nested_items.description: The ID of the association between a network ACL and a subnet.

nested_items.name: NetworkAclId
nested_items.description: The ID of the network ACL.

nested_items.name: SubnetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnet.

nested_items.name: Entries
nested_items.description: The entries (rules) in the network ACL.

nested_items.name: CidrBlock
nested_items.description: The IPv4 network range to allow or deny, in CIDR notation.

nested_items.name: Egress
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the rule is an egress rule (applied to traffic leaving the subnet).

nested_items.name: IcmpTypeCode
nested_items.description: ICMP protocol: The ICMP type and code.

nested_items.name: Code
nested_items.description: The ICMP code. A value of -1 means all codes for the specified ICMP type.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The ICMP type. A value of -1 means all types.

nested_items.name: Ipv6CidrBlock
nested_items.description: The IPv6 network range to allow or deny, in CIDR notation.

nested_items.name: PortRange
nested_items.description: TCP or UDP protocols: The range of ports the rule applies to.

nested_items.name: From
nested_items.description: The first port in the range.

nested_items.name: To
nested_items.description: The last port in the range.

nested_items.name: Protocol
nested_items.description: The protocol number. A value of '-1' means all protocols.

nested_items.name: RuleAction
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to allow or deny the traffic that matches the rule.

nested_items.name: RuleNumber
nested_items.description: The rule number for the entry. ACL entries are processed in ascending order by rule number.

nested_items.name: IsDefault
nested_items.description: Indicates whether this is the default network ACL for the VPC.

nested_items.name: NetworkAclId
nested_items.description: The ID of the network ACL.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Any tags assigned to the network ACL.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC for the network ACL.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the network ACL.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to include in another request to get the next page of items. This value is null when there are no more items to return.
